intro: Semecarpus glaucus, commonly known as the white flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, woody, spiny fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. The tree is also valued for its ornamental appearance and has traditional medicinal uses in some cultures.
